matcher.options: Idle - Waiting for something to happen
Iowait - Waiting for I/O to complete
Nice - Niced processes executing in user mode
Steal - Time spent in other operating systems when running in a virtualized environment
System - Processes executing in kernel mode
User - Normal processes executing in user mode

targets.legendFormat: System - Processes executing in kernel mode
User - Normal processes executing in user mode
Nice - Niced processes executing in user mode
Iowait - Waiting for I/O to complete
Steal - Time spent in other operating systems when running in a virtualized environment
Idle - Waiting for something to happen

matcher.options: Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

targets.legendFormat: Apps - Memory used by user-space applications
PageTables - Memory used to map between virtual and physical memory addresses
SwapCache - Memory that keeps track of pages that have been fetched from swap but not yet been modified
Slab - Memory used by the kernel to cache data structures for its own use (caches like inode, dentry, etc)
Cache - Parked file data (file content) cache
Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

panels.description: Determines the maximum number of concurrent connections to the database server.
panels.title: Max connections

panels.description: Sets the maximum number of background processes that the cluster can support.
panels.title: Max worker processes

panels.description: Sets the maximum number of workers that can be started by a single Gather or Gather Merge node.
panels.title: Max parallel workers

panels.description: Sets the planner's assumption about the effective size of the disk cache that is available to a single query.
panels.title: Effective cache

panels.description: Sets the amount of memory the database server uses for shared memory buffers.
panels.title: Shared buffers

panels.description: Sets the base maximum amount of memory to be used by a query operation (such as a sort or hash table) before writing to temporary disk files.
panels.title: Work mem

panels.description: Specifies the maximum amount of memory to be used by maintenance operations, such as VACUUM, CREATE INDEX, and ALTER TABLE ADD FOREIGN KEY.
panels.title: Maintenance work mem

panels.description: AL the writer sleeps for the length of time given by wal_writer_delay, unless woken up sooner by an asynchronously committing transaction.
panels.title: WAL buffers

panels.description:
Shows the cache hit rate for the database.
pg_stat_database_blks_hit - Number of blocks read directly from the cache
pg_stat_database_blks_read - Number of blocks read directly from disk
panels.title: Cache hit rate

panels.description: The pg_stat_activity view will have one row per server process, showing information related to the current activity of that proces
panels.title: Active connections

panels.description: Number of transactions in this database that have been committed.
panels.title: Number of transaction commits

panels.description: Number of transactions in this database that have been rolled back.
panels.title: Number of transaction rollbacks

panels.description: Number of buffers written during checkpoints.
panels.title: Buffers checkpoint total

panels.description: Number of times this table has been vacuumed by the autovacuum daemon.
panels.title: Autovacuum execution count

panels.description: Number of times this table has been manually vacuumed (not counting VACUUM FULL).
panels.title: Vacuum execution count

panels.description: Estimated number of dead rows.
panels.title: Number of dead tuples in table

panels.description: Number of locks.
panels.title: Lock count

panels.description: Current number of connections for this database.
panels.title: Active connections

panels.description: Maximum number of server connections.
panels.title: Pool size

panels.description: Average number of errors every 15 seconds.
panels.title: Average errors

panels.description: Average of total_wait_time every 15 seconds.
panels.title: Average wait time

panels.description: How many clients are actively communicating with a server.
panels.title: Active clients

panels.description: How many clients are waiting for a connection from the pool.
panels.title: Waiting clients

panels.description: How many clients are idle.
panels.title: Idle clients

panels.description: How many server connections are actively communicating with a client.
panels.title: Active server connections

panels.description: How many server connections are idle.
panels.title: Idle server connections
